alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 25 at 6:23AM CST until November 28 at 8:16AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Red River, Franklin and Titus Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding of lowland areas with some secondary roadways closed. All cattle and equipment nearby the river should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 23.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.2 feet on 06/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 630 AM CST.
